alert.note: Alert for Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 5:42PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado and western Wallace Counties in west central Kansas through 515 PM MDT... At 441 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Weskan, or 17 miles west of Sharon Springs, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado and western Wallace Counties in west central Kansas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for east central Colorado...and west central Kansas.
